text: So how can you avoid this awful jet lag?

I'm here to share my top tips for avoiding
jet lag, so hopefully it works for you on
your next trip.
Prepare Yourself Ahead of Time

If you can, adjust your internal clock several
days before your departure if you can.
What does that even mean?

By shifting your sleeping and eating patterns
to match how they will be in the place you
are travelling to.
It is not time to eat the bun.
Whyyyyyy!

About 4 or 5 days before departure, start
going to sleep and hour and then 2 hours and

then 3 hours, etc before you normally would
or after you normally would; depending on
where you're going.
Avoid caffeine, alcohol, fat and salt

Step 
away from the coffee!

About 4 days before your departure, avoid
caffeine, alcohol, salty and protein heavy
diets.

All of these make it harder for you to fall
asleep and disrupt your sleeping pattern.
Sleep on the Plane

If you can sleep on your flight to your destination,
this will help a lot.
To do so, make yourself tired for the flight.

Don't take a nap before, wear comfortable
clothing and try to get a window seat so you
have somewhere to rest your head.
If not, bring a neck pillow.
You better believe I'm wearing a onsy.

The more tired you are when you board the
flight, the easier it will be to doze off.
Adjust Your Watch

As soon as you board the flight to your destination,
adjust your watch to the new time zone you
are going to be in.

Follow that time as you would on a typical
day.
What time is it?
2PM!
So, it's 9pm.
No, it's 2PM.
Yep, 9PM!
The sun is shining.
It's the afternoon.
Yep, 9PM!!!

If it is the middle of the day in your new
destination, but night time from where you
are departing, stay awake!

Vice versa, if it is night time in your destination
but day time from where you're departing from..then
try and fall asleep as soon as possible.
Wear sunglasses

I read somewhere that wearing sunglasses a
couple of hours before landing in your destination

and a couple of hours after helps adjust your
internal clock by altering your light patterns
Go outside!

Upon arriving at your destination, spend as
much time in the sunlight as you can.
Oh Mr. Sun, Sun!
Oh, you have something on your nose.
Where?
Here?
Here?
Is it gone?
Yeah, you got it.

This will help your body reset it's internal
clock to coincide with you new surroundings.
Sun=STAY AWAKE NO SUN= SLEEPY TIME
Go to Sleep at the Right Time

If you arrive to your destination in the day
super tired since it's nighttime where you
came from, avoid going to sleep right away!
This will prolong the jet lag.

Try to wait it out because even if you take
a nap, this is going to disrupt your new sleep
schedule even more.

I hope these tips helps you avoid the evil
jet lag on your next trip.
Do you have any tips to avoid jet lag?
Share your ideas in the comment box below.
Until next time, happy travels!
